title: Brilliant service
body: Visited on a Saturday teatime as my son had broken his finger. We were seen, xrayed, taped up and away within 30 minutes. Would have been hours in a&e. Would highly recommend

title: Amazing experience
body: From labour ward to the delivery suite, Theatres, Rowan ward and the community Midwives. I could not be more grateful at how I was treated when I had my baby on 31/1. Everybody was so kind and caring, what ended up as a traumatic birth was eased immensely by every staff member who attended to my needs, cared for me, my baby and my husband. I will forever be in their debt for helping me deliver such a beautiful boy. Thankyou to every single one of you.

title: Great receptionist
body: Away from home for a week I realised I’d forgotten my blood pressure tablets. Emailed the surgery explaining my predicament and then rang the surgery expecting a sorry we can’t help. Proved wrong a lovely receptionist showed great empathy, found my email and promised to give it to someone to deal with it. A few hours later she rang me to confirm that a prescription was on its way to my chosen pharmacy and wished a nice holiday. I would like to thank this receptionist she is a great asset to Bexley group practice.

title: Amazing care for new babies and mothers
body: I gave birth in Feb 2023 and our baby needed a short stay in NICU and SCBU. We cannot put into words how amazing the Homerton teams are in NICU and SCBU - they got our daughter back to health so quickly, and were so communicative throughout the whole thing. We always felt confident in their ability to care for her so closely. The teams who work in Delivery as well as the Templar Ward are equally as astonishingly good at what they do - everything in Delivery runs like clockwork, and I always felt safe and listened to. The staff in surgery made me feel calm which I’ve never felt before in a surgical procedure. Templar Ward - the nurses and midwives there are angels. We were treated like people and the kindness they showed me is something I’ll never forget. My husband and I are forever indebted to everyone in these teams who looked after all of us with such gentle care at a really vulnerable time. Thank you so much.

title: Amazing Practice. Fantastic Service.
body: Called up at 8am and was 18th in the queue. Managed to get an appointment with the GP on the same day. The doctor called me in and examined me later that morning. I was also recommended to see the physiotherapist which was booked in 2 days time. Really fantastic service. The doctor was very thorough. The receptionists were so lovely, especially having witnessed them deal with some very rude people in the waiting room. I've been registered at this surgery for 5 years having had experience with some other local GP surgeries, and can honestly say this is the best surgery in this area.

title: Great Experience
body: My mum Pauline, had to have both her eyes lasered after cataract surgery 18 month ago.  She was very satisfied with the service she received from the healthcare professionals.

title: Great Practice
body:
I have been registered with this practice for a lifetime. I can honestly say that I have always received care and attention on every call and consultation. We all also need to understand that the local population has grown alongside covid restrictions that have had some detrimental effect on all of us. How everything when I or members of my family have needed healthcare this has been provided with individual care and dedicated time for appointments. What I do see when I need to visit which isn’t very often is the amount of patients not attending for appointments which is causing other patients delays, those patients who don’t attend who cannot be bothered to cancel should be taken off the register after missing 3 or more appointments. The nhs does a fantastic service for the uk and we have to remind ourselves how lucky we are. Not all faults of the nhs service are down to a practice. 
The whole team in this practice are caring and doing a fantastic job. The is barely a visit that I don’t leave with a smile, they make me feel that I’m a patient that is given what ever time is needed. I am a terrible patient for blood giving yet the nurses alway treat me with extreme care and somehow make me feel at ease. 
The doctors in this practice should be praised more for what they do; from personally experience over the years truly miss those doctors who have retired and am pleased that this practice has a core group of doctors that have worked here for many years which help with relationship with patients. 
Thank you Havant health centre for looking after me and my family.

title: Pleasant and Caring Practice
body: I recently moved to the area and was recommended this practice. Since I registered they have brought my general health check up to date, suggested that I have a couple of vaccinations and helped with a problem. All the staff have been very helpful and friendly and as I was quite anxious due to the move that was very important. So far my experience has been very positive.

title: Paulo the physio
body: Very impressed with consultation I had with Paulo the physio and action plan proposed.  A great asset to the surgery.

title: Good Service
body: I received very professional and friendly service from all members of staff also I was kept informed regarding my appointment

title: Very pleased
body: My wife and I transferred to the surgery primarily to have a GP within walking distance. However, we have been amazed how efficient, helpful and pro-active the staff have been and we have been very happy with the service.

title: No continuity of care
body: Each appointment or review is with a different person. There is **no** continuity of care. As a healthcare professional specialising in quality and outcomes I find this very worrying

title: Wonderful service
body:
The service and treatment that I received at Claremont was first class. I was greeted professionally on the day I arrived for surgery and taken to my room. Post surgery, nurses were attentive ( and friendly ), ensuring that I was comfortable and as pain free as possible. On both mornings of my hospital stay, I was brought a cup of tea ( and biscuits ) by the nurse whilst my blood pressure was taken at 6 am, something I greatly appreciated ( and something I suspect was not obligatory ).
To conclude, many many thanks to Claremont for providing me with such wonderful service, and I hope my comments are passed onto staff who had dealings with me.

title: Fantastic staff and level of care
body: I just wanted to leave a review and say thank you to all of the staff who looked after me during my stay on ward 227 after my motorcycle accident,I can't thank them enough for making a very tough and stressful time much better, they were extremely professional and skilled in their work but also very friendly and down to earth so much so I was actually a little sad to leave,all I can say is thank you and keep up the good work!

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

title: First class practice the rece
body:
The reception Nurses and Doctors are experienced and caring
Dedicated to their patients 
A great team

title: Great GP
body: Dr Yarnell was fantastic with my son as he doesn’t like the Dr visits usually. On the last two visits he as seen Dr Yarnell.  She listened to him and my concerns, this meant I didn’t have to repeat info previously discussed which saved time. Encouraged my son to speak up and be involved in the consultation making him feel at ease. I know if I have further concerns I will be requesting Dr Yarnell as she is thorougher, listens to the answer and is approachable, you don’t feel rushed in and out.

title: Great service
body:
I am the one who was smiling.
Big thanks to the team in the mri department for your perfect and professionally organised mri scan. 
You are very helpful and kind people.
 Big thanks to all of you for your such important work.

title: So grateful
body: I have had a swollen mouth for a few weeks which I kept hoping would clear and caused me a lot of discomfort.  I had a phonecall appointment with the Duty Doctor on the same day of my request who prescribed me drops which have cleared the problem so quickly.  It is such a relief to be free of pain and be able to get back to functioning.  Thank you so very much.

title: Great
body: I use e-consult and always get a call the next day. GPs are very nice and very helpful. Can see patients face to face ASAP if needed. Great work to all staff. Thank you

title: Impossible to get an appointment
body: I have called several times since December 22, as of today 5 Feb 23 still not been able to get an appointment or even get through on the phone or by e-mail.  In fact emails are never answered!

title: Fantastic Support
body: I can't thank Lucy and the Team enough. I was at a very low point in my life and my regular sessions with Lucy helped me so much. I gradually learnt the tools and skills to help me move forward and Lucy's ongoing, support, care and encouragement lifted me from the depths of my despair to feeling life had meaning again and that I could make a difference. Thank you so much, your care and encouragement made a huge difference to me. I really hope other people reach out in their hour of need and are are to access the tools I was able to, to help them move forward and focus on the small steps they can take each day to motivate and uplift them to a better place. Thank you so much.

readBy.name: South West London and St George's Mental Health NHS Trust

title: Excellent Care
body:
I was brought in by ambulance from Westmorland General with extremely high blood pressure. I was triaged quickly and then had a brain scan. I was the taken to a cubicle and during the next few hours had various tests, medication to try to lower my blood pressure, and the scan results. At all times the staff were courteous 
and caring, including bringing a cup of tea both for my daughter-in-law and myself. I was visited by two doctors who explained the problem which was preventing me from being discharged. Finally the doctors were happy and I was able to leave, at ten past ten. I should like to express my particular thanks to Dr Julia Marshall for taking the time to talk to me and explain the problems. I was delighted with my care.

title: The most horrible and rude midwifes
body: After the ceserian I was experiencing huge abdominal pain .Been crying and crying but no-one came to help or assist.All they was telling :"You must walk" They didn't care how you feel, all they care how to free up the bed ...They was ride, not helpful at any degree. Not what you expecting being a new mum ..Avoid this hospital

readBy.name: Birmingham Women's and Children's NHS Foundation Trust

title: No communication, no help, no appointment
body: I’ve spent hours trying to speak to someone at BMEC about an urgent Vitrectomy referral, made 3 months ago. No-one answers the phones. You get passed from department to department. My eyesight is deteriorating, and there’s been no communication. There’s a 6 month window for success, and I’m 3 months into that. If I lose my eyesight, I lose my livelihood.

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: NHS App
body: Following my previous post I was able to access my test results within 24 hours of submission via my NHS App. The PATCHs and NHS App combination enabled me to access the surgery and treatment easily and quickly. The App also shows my previous medical history - I had forgotten about a couple of items! It does take a little while to set up but definitely worth doing.

title: Insufficient Pain Relief
body: Surgeon removed wisdom teeth and gave me no painkillers to take home I complained a day or so later and was told to take paracetemol.

title: Caring practice
body: Staff always show concern about my welfare and the way l am feeling. I always feel at ease for what ever my visit is for

title: Fantastic service
body:
I have had the most fantastic service from Newton Place in the last 2 weeks. 3 face to face appointments in 3 days, professional, kind and knowledgeable staff and rapid onward referrals made.
At least 6 different staff at the Practice have been involved and all have been excellent.
Thank you

title: NHS at its best.
body:
I had elective Parathyroidectomy surgery Feb 3rd. 
I cannot thank enough to all those involved in my procedure. So grateful to  the Surgeon, to whom I had full confidence in that I knew I had the ‘best of the best, 
& to his assistant Surgeon, the anaesthetists, the theatre staff to & the staff on Ward 16, I thank you all.

title: No one answers the phone
body: My Father was admitted to Good Hope hospital, I don't live in the uk, constantly telephoning the hospital, no one answers. Eventually get cut off. Terrible service.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Perfect experience
body:
Shoulder injury. 
Everyone from reception to radiography(?) was friendly, informative, relaxed and helpful.
I was in and out in under 2hrs.
The painkillers and exercises ensure I'll be back to work soon.
A faultless service. Many thanks.

title: Horrific practice
body: I haven’t been able to get through to sort my medication for over a month now and thanks to them I’ve got a lot worst they’d normally sort it over phone and so I rang for more meds and a woman said to do it online and I tried for weeks couldn’t do I so I’ve rang everyday for over a week to sort it and can’t get through

title: So difficult to get an appointment
body: My son needed an appointment,  could never get through on the phone, so I went to the surgery to request an appointment.... the receptionist refused to help and told me to book through the website. I pointed out that they had sent a text on 6th January saying appointments could no longer be booked online, she advised they could through their website. Went on to website, answered their questions but still no option to book an appointment, just got an email confirming they had received the request and aim to respond in 24 hours. A doctor did call back within a couple of hours, but just confirmed his identity and gave an appointment for the following morning.... this could have been done by a receptionist?... arrived at Kenley surgery at scheduled time, where he was told the appointment was at Purley Hospital..... as Kenley is his surgery and where he has always been seen, they should have told him it would not be at that location.... Receptionists used to make appointments,  check us in, deal with prescription requests answer phones etc...  now we check ourselves in,  assess ourselves request appointments and prescriptions through their website and a doctor then makes the appointment. Is it really too much to expect them to answer the phone in a reasonable amount of time?.....It's no wonder Hospitals are overwhelmed as seeking medical help before you're seriously ill is so hard

title: Impossible to contact non-urgent out of hours
body:
For several years now, the practice has been completely uncontactable out of hours. I often find I have non-urgent or admin queries out of hours (like over the weekend) that do not need to be triaged or dealt with until later the following week but due to suffering very bad brain fog, I will usually forget I need to ask the question by Monday. 
For example, today I want to know if there is any way I can have a back-up prescription for my meds as (thanks, brain fog) I often forget to order them, and spend several days off them; like at the moment. That’s a really non-urgent query but I have to wait until Monday to ask (either by eConsult - what a waste of triage time - or by spending an hour or so on the phone - what a waste of mine and the receptionists time). At which point, I’ll be back at work, hopefully have collected my meds and won’t even remember I needed to ask the question. 
As someone who is a sufferer of two long-term chronic illnesses that can cause severe brain fog, I often feel quite excluded by this lack of communication options and like I’m left with no where to turn. Which has had me extremely upset and in tears on several occasions because I can’t even send an email with a simple admin query.
I have reviewed this similar experience several times for years via the feedback button on their online consultation service, but have seen no change. I don’t see the point in an online consult service that is still only available during practice hours. Surely it’d be easier at that point to call the surgery? Personally, I think that’s why the phone lines are still so busy. When they first installed the eConsult service, you were able to submit a consult at any time day or night, which was perfect. It would then be triaged the next time the practice was open and dealt with accordingly. If this was the case, I wouldn’t even mind using the service to submit admin/non-urgent queries in place of an email address. 
I really thought that the eConsult service was going to be the solution to overloaded practice receptions but it’ll never work if it’s only as convenient as making the phone call anyway. At least then people know someone’s already heard them.

title: A wast of space.
body:
Since having a lovely brand new building, it has been impossible to get an appointment yet it is laughable to read new patients can register here, when they can't even cater for those that are already registered. It is frightening to be ill because this surgery will be neither use nor ornament to help.
I damaged my knee in October that I now realise is healing incorrectly courtesy of this shambolic service, as to date I still have not had an appointment  Call backs were made at specific times I stressed not to call, so evidently they cannot understand a simple instruction. A complaint was submitted and all you ever get his sorry.
I have tried several times to get an appointment for a number of ailments all of which have been a total waste of time with this surgery. Yet they send out reminders for blood tests etc just so they can tick a box and make out they they are doing their job.
This practise should be closed down as it is not fit for purpose and made into something that the local community can actually access and more so benefit from.
I honestly cannot remember the last time I saw a doctor at this practise and I am living with with a number of conditions that have steadily worsened courtesy of this waste of space service.

title: Well done Castle Mead Medical Centre
body: I rang Castle Mead Medical Centre at a few minutes past 8am on Thursday 2nd February 2023. I took the ring back option and got the callback about 10 minutes later. I had a conversation with a very pleasant lady who even suggested that I should have a double appointment with a GP and booked it in for later that morning. According to the newspapers a lot of people are complaining that they can’t get GP appointments for one reason or the other. Castle Mead seems to be bucking that trend and as such I think they deserve congratulating.

title: Super care and professionalism
body:
I attended the new Endoscopy department for a 9.30am procedure under sedation on Friday 27 January and in the recovery area I suffered what I believe is called a "waking seizure".Apparently I was "out of it" for about 20 seconds and woke to be surrounded by doctors and nurses.Fortunately,I recovered fully and was eventually discharged after blood tests at around 6.40 pm. 
All the time there I received first class care and attention from everyone but I have to particularly praise the Recovery Unit Auxiliary Nurse (who only works two days per week) for her excellent customer care and professionalism.Apart from regularly checking all patients,I was kept fully informed at all times and the tea and biscuits were very much appreciated! This nurse also stayed beyond her leaving time to make sure the results of my blood tests were received to allow my discharge in the evening.
I was only in the unit for one day but I was extremely impressed and very grateful for my treatment.Many thanks.
My wife ,who waited all day for me, also said how kind all reception staff were to her keeping her informed and being helpful.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Unaccomodating
body: The Doctors are lovely, and most of the receptionists are polite and helpful, but one, who has been rude on several occasions to myself and other patients, and has recently un-registered me because temporarily out of area for 12 weeks, without informing me. Despite the website saying that they take patients from out of area too. Coming back to local area in 4 weeks, but now without a GP.

title: Feel let Down by the system
body:
Had Telephone Appointment with Dr,Told he wanted face to face Appointment with me,Contact surgery after 1week,no appointments,Called In surgery again after 2week wait,no appointments,Why are we told to ring surgery at 8am or go there 8am, if they have appointments why do I need to contact them When Dr,said I need Face to Face appointment,Still Waiting 
After 2weeks ,Just wonder how much worse it can get,the system needs sorting,stress levels getting worse with Patients,

title: Rude Doctor
body: When visiting the GP with a family member this particular GP implied I was more bothered myself than the family member. Felt like I wasnt heard and didnt get the help I wanted in the form of antibiotics

title: Great practice and nurses
body: I had to have cysts drained in an ED department and had to go to to the practice to have dressings changed daily for a couple of weeks. The nurse that did my dressing changes was very friendly, kind and really made the painful experience more bearable. I would definitely recommend her and the practice to others as they always help me when I needed it.

title: Friendly and helpful
body: I find the staff and Dr's to very friendly helpful and approachable. Although if you ring at 8am or 1pm there are likely to be long queues due to that being peak appointment booking times and I feel like there should be more staff on at this busy time as sometimes you call at 8 or 1 and by the time you get through appointments are then unavailable. Other than that a great practice.

title: lovely nursing staff
body: lovely nursing staff-thank you all so much for looking after me on 6th and 7th January,very best wishes to you all,jenn

title: good
body: Staff is friendly and helpful, i didn't found any issue, I didn't had anything serious but the centre was always available to give advices

title: Great Practise
body: Never any problems getting an Appointment.  I've Always been able to either see or Speak to Doctor regarding any health problems..

title: Wonderful
body: Staff very friendly and informative. I was put at ease as soon as I entered. The whole process was carried out extremely professionally and I was able to ‘see’ the results in 24 hours.

title: Great care
body: The doctor was wonderful, caring and took time to listen. Reassured me and gave me good advice as well as helping with the issue attending the appointment

title: Fantastic Practice
body: Due to a long term medical condition, I visit the surgery for routine check ups and blood tests etc. the doctors and nurses are first class and extremely professional, whilst remaining warm and friendly. I feel very confident knowing that my well-being is in their hands.

title: Reassuring Experience
body: From submitting request was given face 2 face appointment with Dr within 24hrs and received treatment and reassurance. Amazing NHS service.

title: Excellent practice
body: All the doctors and staff are very helpful and friendly, an excellent GP practice. Easy to book an appointment where I know friends  at other practices struggle.

title: Great service
body: Having moved to Medwyn in the last year I’ve found them head and shoulders ahead of my previous practise in service, willingness to listen and attitude to helping. It is also much easier to make appointments and the wait for an appointment is shorter. All staff have been courteous and caring. Thank you Medwyn.

title: Excellent service
body: I was admitted to day surgery for pain care. From start to finish, my mind was put at rest,by the kind and caring nurses. My surgery procedure was professional, and again the nurse were very kind and professional. After making sure I was ok to leave (following coffee and biscuits) I was given instructions as to my aftercare,so overall a very satisfactory experience.

title: Always helpful
body: I always get helpful and prompt treatment and advice at this surgery in pleasant surroundings whether attending in person or over the phone

title: Poor service
body: I’m currently 6 months pregnant and i’ve been struggling to get in contact with a midwife regarding appointment changes. I’ve left a voicemail with my name and phone number & i still haven’t got any contact back. From my december appointment, i was tested and was asked to contact them if i haven’t received my results within two weeks. I did give it time as there was the strikes going on but till this day, 5th of February, i still haven’t received anything. It is a bit of an inconvenience as this is my first child, and my first experience and i never felt so alone in my pregnancy.

title: Friendly, professional and efficient.
body: I came to have a leg with cellulitis redressed. The nurse took great care and much time to clean it up before dressing it. I left feeling I had been exceptionally well cared for.

title: very good experience
body:
I was pleasantly surprised by the speed of my referral for cataract surgery and subsequent pre-op and surgery dates took place. Everyone was very pleasant and helpful. There was plenty of opportunity to find out information about the procedure and to ask any questions I had or arose during the visits. I had known very little about the procedure prior to the pre-op visit and was much reassured by the care I received. 
The facilities are very good, with free hot drinks and biscuits for myself and my husband, who was my driver for the day, should we require them. There is always someone to contact if if I  had any issues whilst waiting to be called in for my op. 
Altogether, it was a much more pleasant experience than I had expected and the outcome - which I know can be variable in how long it takes to show - for me, at least, has been an amazing improvement in the sight of my left eye. A big 'thank you' to all involved in my care and treatment.

title: Great practice
body: Very quick response to my concern relating to potential infection. At conclusion of period for prescribed medication, further contact and with a degree of ‘unknown’ as to cause, further tests arranged.

title: Great service when I needed it
body: I'm not a patient here, my friend is. I needed  urgent help for my friend, I have to say I was so grateful to everyone that helped me. From the receptionists, to the nurse and doctors, I am so thank full to you all.

title: Physio
body: I like the fact I fill in a form online and I always hear promptly from the practice. I had tingling in my hands and numbness for a while.  I saw the physio, got some exercises for my neck and it is much better.  I have contacted the practice about a few things lately and found them efficient and very helpful.

title: Great medical practice
body:
Superb all the way through the last 5 weeks when I have been unwell
All the GPS, nurse Practitioners & receptionists have been friendly & helpful

title: Good practice
body: Helpful medical staff. Clean and tidy waiting area. Clean toilets  Good other services available on the same site for physio foot problem etc , helpful chemist area, very happy with Doctors and how they deal with patient's.

title: Superb service
body: I had to have blood tests and an ECG..was easy to get back to back appointments within a week, even though 2 different nurses were required. Tests were done on time, quickly and efficiently by very friendly nurses who were both brilliant at calming my nerves.

title: great practice.
body: i felt i was important to the staff and they listened to what i had to say.  it was a very welcoming practice warm and welcoming.

title: We are very fortunate
body: My GP takes care of my health without even being asked. I appreciate this hugely. This a a most efficient and friendly practice with a very high level of patient care.

title: Amazing service in Childrens a&e
body:
We went to the children's a&e this morning. We was seen by the triage nurse quite soon after arriving. Then we was seen by the lead nurse who diagnosed an ear infection and went and got the antibiotics straight away. 
From start to finish all staff was smiling, caring and listening. 
The waiting room was full of books and toys to keep the children happy. 
The service was amazing. Thank you so much again.

readBy.name: Royal United Hospital Bath NHS Trust
Plymouth University, BSc (Hons) Urgent and Emergency Care 2022

title: Appalling treatment
body: As a diabetic who diabetes has been incredibly unstable for the last 10 weeks without reason. I have tried for the last 10 weeks to get an appointment I have rung and been refused an appointment, I have gone in and been refused appointments. I urgently need a follow up blood test and have been refused a blood test. If I go blind or a lose a leg is the surgery responsible because they won't see me. The receptionist who are in know way medically qualified are making dangerous medical decisions about people's health. The phone lines are horrific  everyone rings at 8am you can press redial 70-80 times to get hold of anyone to be told no one will see you today.  This practice needs a serious review how it treats patients with long term health conditions, how receptionist refuse appointments and the appalling lack of patients care.

title: Very efficient
body:
Submitted an email request online. Received an answer by text within 30 minutes from the GP with an appointment within 3 days at requested time for the first response practitioner (a fysio in this case).
She did a thorough check, took enough time and gave helpfull advice.
Everything very efficient. Thank you.

title: Staff doing a great job
body: Busy Sunday afternoon in A&E, staff chatty and polite even when working under these extreme pressures. Thank you NHS, your staff are the best.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent service
body:
I was treated promptly with reassuring efficiency and with warmth and friendliness.
I was kept informed about my diagnosis 
test results and proposed treatment and at the end of my stay the senior doctor explained what my likely course of treatment would be and he gave me several opportunities to to ask questions

title: Hard to reach
body: Hard to reach the hospital from the station. A courtesy vehicle is available that taxis patients and staff from the station to the hospital, but it’s in such high demand that you can be waiting a long time in the cold for the next car. Also, people pile in and don’t respect the queueing - and the driver parks near the end of the queue rather than the front, so you could have been waiting longer than everyone at the front of the queue, but the driver pulls up at the other end, so the people waiting the least amount of time get on first without any shame. More cars needed especially in winter. And drivers who know where the front of the queue is.

title: What a lovely nurse
body: I attended the practice on Saturday 4th Feb 2023 for an appointment with a nurse for a smear test. I was feeling a little nervous about my appointment but she was amazing at making me feel calm and at ease about the smear. She made sure I was completely ready before carrying it out and made sure I didn't have any questions or worries before she did anything. She knew I was a bit nervous and so took her time and explained everything to me and made sure I was comfortable throughout. A lovely lady, kind, compassionate and really put my mind at ease.

title: Indifference to patients
body: I have been suffering from my loin and back pain, and abnormal discharge for several months. Last time I saw the doctor, he barely listened to me at all. I was waiting for this appointment so long, and nothing has been done! They only gave me a urologist appointment for July!! (Now is beginning of Feb.) The only thing the doctor could say - is to wait until I am worse, then go to an emergency. I am currently staying in bed most of the time because of pain, but no one cares.

title: Superb Service
body: Diagnosed with blood in poo 13 Jan, phone call from Eccleshill 17 Jan, Colonoscopy assessment 18th Jan, procedure 20 Jan. Absolutely excellent service. All involved were very caring, thoughtful and empathetic throughout. At 74, I was initially very concerned but the way I was treated was so reassuring. Even during the procedure, the nurse chatting away to me took my mind off of what was happening, and the procedure report by the Dr. was clear and concise. Well Done to all involved, one couldn't fault the process in any way, yet another example of the superb service the NHS carries out daily. Thank You.

title: First Class Practice
body:
I was reminded last week of how fortunate I am to be a patient as this surgery where we are offered a choice of ways to get advice from a clinician - Telephone Advice Line (every weekday 8-10am), a bookable face-to-face or telephone appointment, an online consultation.  On Wednesday I opted to call the Telephone Advice Line.  I was in a queue, but this went down fairly quickly.  The doctor I spoke took time to listen and discuss my problem and agree a plan of action.  Half an hour after initiating the call, I came away feeling reassured, with a prescription sent to the pharmacy, a blood test form left at Reception and the knowledge that I would be reviewed regularly.
Thank you Paxton Green

title: Excellent service
body: Made an online request for a skin complaint that my daughter had. Received a very quick response asking for photographs which was followed up same day by a call from a doctor. Medication prescribed and all sorted now. Very happy with the service and response.

title: Great Practice
body: Visited practice on Friday,Go very thorough & listened to what I was saying.Receptionist very helpful got blood test appointment on same day . Can’t praise the practice highly enough .

title: Problem solved quickly
body: I needed to speak to a doctor just before the surgery closed on Friday evening. The receptionist made sure she contacted a doctor and I received a phone call and prescription for antibiotics so I didn’t need to contact 111

title: Friendly & efficient
body: Made my high cholesterol diagnosis via blood test ECG etc with the nurse plus doctor liaison very easy and reassuring

title: Swift attention
body: They followed up quickly on a routine test which revealed a potential problem. Communication was good by phone call, text and in person.  I was seen promptly in person and given the time needed to resolve issues.

title: Avoid!
body:
I joined the practise 2 months ago and have had several interaction - all pretty terrible!
The reception team are, on the whole, lovely. A rare thing in gp surgeries! They are helpful and supportive.
One gp is brilliant, if only their colleagues were of similar standard!
I was given a different patients blood test forms as well as my sons, breaching GDPR. 
I was then made to drive my sick child back to the surgery to return the forms and correct their error.
You cannot call for an appointment, you use an online service which is often closed by 09:30 so you can’t get a call back or a message to your gp if something happens after that time.
A gp didn’t read my request following a car accident and closed it down incorrectly, further delaying treatment. 25mins on hold trying to get someone to answer the phone so I could try to sort it out (approx. 15:00)
I was the next day called by someone to book in to what I now know to be the muscularskeletal team. Unfortunately this was being mid-pronounced and when I asked what that was, they didn’t know but had booked lots of people in that day! Without any contact from a gp, the context was lost. Either the admin needed better education, or there was a step in the process missing.
I tried to book my sons immunisations and flu jab. They wouldn’t let me book it together (unlike previous experiences), I had to have 2 appointments. When I got there, the nurse was baffled and administered all in one go.
I didn’t actually register with this practise. I registered with the sister surgery and got allocated to this one. So much for patient choice!
I will be leaving.

title: Appalling Service
body: It's a pity the staff do not know their published processes and procedures. The surgery has cancelled its extended hours services, Saturday services etc. So what service does it provide? The website states that - "appointments are available throughout the day during our opening hours and can be booked online, by telephone or in-person at the reception desk. Please select one of the below appointment types, to get the best suited help on time. I was in the surgery, when a patient came in to book an appointment - only to be told that reception staff no longer booked appointments! I tried to book appointment on line after 6.30 pm on Friday  only to be told service not available till 08.00 Monday. What are patients supposed to do if you don't work from home and no access to appointment system during the working day?

title: Great practice
body:
After proactive test and issue was seen very quickly and the for subsequent tests. Appointment were good friendly and great staff

Big thank you

title: The best practice
body: I wish my doctors were closer to where I live but I would never change! Even though there is a different practice here. Medwyn Surgery has been the best experience for my health. The staff are kind, compassionate and understanding. They don’t treat you like a number but like a human being which is everything.

title: Telephone answering service dreadful.
body: I telephoning the Clementine Churchill Hospital approximately 10 times over 5 days about a query I had about my outpatient appointment. Not once was the phone answered. I left a message and no one ever returned my call.

title: Thank you
body: I attended the emergency treatment centre yesterday,  I had to wait an hour or so and that was fine as the department was very busy. I was treated well, prescribed antibiotics. The staff do an amazing job, thank you to everyone that looked after me.

title: Brilliant Doctor
body: Saw a doctor on 4.2.23 what a wonderful caring GP he didn’t rush me just sat and listened and sorted me. Thank you so much

author: Niamhh1
title: great staff
body:
The staff in Lurgan are just so great, everyone has been so amazing and are very helpful with everything. They deserve a great big pat on the back for their work!  
The food in Lurgan has been pretty decent, I have definitely had worse.  
The cleanliness is excellent, a very clean hospital indeed.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Tersg66
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I feel very reassured after every conversation
body: My stay so far has been very good. I came in threw ED and was so shocked at how fast I was seen. The nurse that looked after me was an absolute gem! She was so good. The doctors were very thorough. I was admitted up to female surgical and couldn’t fault anything at all. The staff up here are very obliging. Nothing is any trouble. They are always so busy but still ensure each and every one is seen to. They are such lovely ladies. Very friendly and caring. The doctors that come round and see me are very good. I feel very reassured after every conversation. I am in excellent hands. The food is lovely. I’m spoilt getting three great meals for breakfast, lunch and dinner. I have never been this well fed before. The cleaning staff are wonderful. They give the ward a very thorough clean every day. It’s shining. The care and hospitality has been wonderful. I’m very appreciative of everything that everyone has done for me so far. The Female surgical ward is brilliant.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Niamhh1
title: Excellent care
body:
The care in Lurgan hospital has been fabulous! The staff are so hard working and they have a brilliant team of nurses. Everyone has been so friendly and always keen to have a chat.  
The cleaning staff are great, the ward is absolutely spotless, you could not fault them.  
The food is really nice, I really like the soup and will have it most days.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Niamhh1
title: Alright food, poor variety
body:
I have been in Lurgan hospital for about 2 weeks, all the staff have been brilliant at taking great care of me, I couldn't ask for much more from them. They are second to none!  
The food is alright, there's definitely a lot more they could do with the menus, in terms of more variety.  
The cleanliness is superb, 100%.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: wearingmn64
title: Poor service on this occassion
body:
I visited Healthharmonie at Anglesey Street, Hednesford, for an appointment.  
No receptionist on duty. I was shouted from the room at bottom of corridor to go down. Usually they come and collect you. I was surprised at this as its not very professional at all. Felt worthless to be honest and was not impressed at all.  
I usually have good service when visiting but not this time

title: Excellent practice
body: Helpful, courteous and professional staff. Well maintained and always clean and tidy. Having the pharmacy onsite is very useful.

title: outstanding practice
body:
responsive and professional throughout
all staff members are helpful and efficient.
great medical care and expertise

title: Excellent service
body:
I brought my son to A&E on early morning of 5 February 23 with a suspected heart condition. The receptionist was efficient and professional; a triage nurse saw him within a few minutes, and by a doctor almost as soon as we got to the waiting room. In my opinion the care he received throughout was excellent.”
 Everyone was so kind. The staff - doctor and nurses are professional and efficient.

author: Mourne Resident
title: 5 star treatment
body:
I experienced 5 star treatment at Downpatrick Downe Hospital.  
My outpatient experience involved a visit to Trauma & Orthopaedics (ICATS).The consultant, Gerard, was very patient, gentle, professional and thorough. He referred me for X-rays and personally walked me to the X-ray department. The extremely polite reception asked me to take a seat in the waiting room. I was called for X-rays , even before my seat was warm !  
Avril the technician displayed extreme understanding & compassion in exercising her series of pictures. The whole process for me was made enjoyable for me by the happy attitude of these professionals.  
I left feeling very proud and privileged, to experience such 5 star treatment in my own county of Down.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Outstanding Practice
body: We have been registered with the Medwyn Practice for over 25 years and the service we have received over that time has been excellent.  But it continues to improve.  We are grateful to be registered with such a professional practice.

title: Excellent Care
body: I walked into A and E after work on Thursday 26 Jan with sickness and disorientation.  I was called to triage and nearly passed out. Was taken to cubicles and from there until I was discharged on Sunday 29th received the very best care.  Fully informed by nursing staff, surgeon and was treated with care and respect.  Catering staff very helpful and the food was really good.  Cleaning team and porters helpful and considerate.  All in all a great experience and grateful for being looked after by a great team.  Thanks and well done.  I have looked for the right place to send a letter to the Trust but can only find a complaints department, shame, a thanks department would be good as well.  Cheers!

title: Saturday cervical smear clinic
body: Great to discover they also do this clinic on Saturdays.The nurse I saw was lovely, she was very caring and understanding about my concerns, and very helpful in resolving other issues.Thoroughly recommend .

title: Good service
body: Always call when they say they will and are always empathetic with a good range of knowledge- very happy with the service

title: Excellent patient care
body: After leaving an econsult I received an email to say when to expect a call. I had a call from my GP who was fantastic (Dr F). I then needed blood tests which I was able to go and have within the hour of his call! What a great service! I’ve been at this surgery for years, I’ve never had a problem, all staff are great and I’m really grateful for the care i receive - thank you
